page.title: 12FARMING BROTHERS IN LYVEDEN
page.content: There are two brothers who farm in Lyveden very close to each other. Their farms are about half a mile apart. They have lived there for over two generations. They own about 250 acres each, and they farm arable crops, cattle and sheep. The two farms are called Springwood House and Springwood Lodge. In winter Lyveden particularly suffers, as the harsh snow falls drift a lot in that area.We were told by the inhabitants of Springwood lodge that in the winter of 1981 they were snowed in for five days. During that time no vehicles could get through the snow blocks. They claimed the snow was at hedge height(5 or 6 feet). This whole area is usually very dry and averages less than 25 inches of rain per annum, which is one reason why lots of cereal crops are grown on arable farms here.
